wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Gronow Davis VC (16 May 1828 – 18 October 1891) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Gronow Davis || British Army || 1855 || Crimean War || Sebastopol

Lieutenant Colonel H. F. Strange CB commanded his company, and Captain Gronow Davis commanded the spiking party. Capt. Gronow Davis also received the Victoria Cross for his actions at the Redan on 8 September 1855.
